alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 08 at 6:24PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BAY...NORTHERN SAGINAW AND SOUTHEASTERN MIDLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EST... At 620 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Merrill, or 10 miles southwest of Midland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saginaw, Midland, Bay City, Auburn, Freeland, Kawkawlin, Essexville, Zilwaukee, Merrill, Munger, Carrollton, Nelson, Swan Creek, Garfield, Arthur, Buena Vista Township, Poseyville, Indiantown, Laporte, and Hemlock. This includes the following highways... I-75 between mile markers 149 and 171. I-675 between mile markers 1 and 7. US-10 between mile markers 127 and 139. Another compact thunderstorm south of this initial storm may also produce small pea sized hail and gusty winds as it tracks into the Saginaw area over the next half hour or so. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
